sen.j: 園国子（その くにこ、寛永元年（1624年）－延宝5年7月5日 (旧暦)（1677年8月3日））は、江戸時代前期の皇族。
sen.e: Kuniko SONO (1624 - August 3, 1677) was of the imperial family during the early part of the Edo Era.
sen.cmt: 生まれた月日がありませんが、そのまま訳しました。
sen.e: Kuniko SONO (1624 - August 3, 1677) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early part of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: a memberを補いました。imperial family→Imperial Family,Era→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Kuniko SONO (1624 - August 3, 1677) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early part of the Edo period.

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の後宮の一人。
sen.e: She was one of the consorts of Emperor Gomizunoo.
She was one of the consorts of the Emperor Gomizunoo.
She was one of the consorts of the Emperor Gomizunoo.
She was the real mother of Emperor Reigen.
She was the real mother of the Emperor Reigen.
She was the real mother of the Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 院号は新広義門院（しんこうぎもんいん）。
sen.e: Her Ingo (title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor) was Shinkogimonin.
Her Ingo (title of respect given to close female relatives of the emperor) was Shinkogimonin.
Her Ingo (title of respect given to close female relatives of the emperor) was Shinkogimonin.

sen.j: 父は権大納言園基音（薨去後左大臣追贈）。
sen.e: Her father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Councilor) Motonari SONO (who was given the posthumous court rank of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
Her father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Councilor) Motonari SONO (who was given the posthumous court rank of Sadaijin [Minister of the Left]).
sen.cmt: カッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Her father was Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Councilor) Motonari SONO (who was given the posthumous court rank of Sadaijin [Minister of the Left]).

sen.j: 母は山家藩主谷衛友の娘。
sen.e: Her mother was the daughter of Moritomo TANI of the Yamaga Domain.
Her mother was the daughter of Moritomo TANI, the lord of the Yamaga Domain.
Her mother was the daughter of Moritomo TANI, the lord of the Yamaga Domain.

sen.j: 兄に准大臣園基福がいる。
sen.e: Her brother was Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Motoyoshi SONO.
Her brother was Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Motoyoshi SONO.
Her brother was Jun-daijin (Vice Minister) Motoyoshi SONO.

sen.j: 園家の本姓は藤原氏であるので、藤原国子（ふじわら の くにこ）と記されることもあり。
sen.e: She is sometimes referred to as FUJIWARA no Kuniko, as the main name of the Sono family was that of the Fujiwara clan.
Her name is sometimes written as FUJIWARA no Kuniko, as the original name of the Sono family was the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: She→Her name,referred to→written,main→original と修正しました。that of を削除しました。
sen.e: Her name is sometimes written as FUJIWARA no Kuniko, as the original name of the Sono family was the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 叔母の園光子（壬生院）に続いて彼女も後水尾天皇の後宮として召された。
sen.e: She was called to be the consort of the Emperor, following her aunt, Mitsuko SONO (Mibuin).
She was called to be the consort of the Emperor Gomizunoo, following her aunt, Mitsuko SONO (Mibuin).
sen.cmt: the→a と修正しました。Gomizunoo を補いました。
sen.e: She was called to be the consort of the Emperor Gomizunoo, following her aunt, Mitsuko SONO (Mibuin).

sen.j: 天皇とは28歳差であった。
sen.e: She was 28 years younger than the Emperor.
She was 28 years younger than the emperor.
She was 28 years younger than the emperor.

sen.j: 典侍となり、従三位に叙せられた。
sen.e: She was given the rank of Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and was given the rank of Jusammi.
She became Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and was conferred the rank of Jusanmi.
sen.cmt: was given the rank of→became,given→conferred,Jusammi→Jusanmi と修正しました。
sen.e: She became Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) and was conferred the rank of Jusanmi.

sen.j: 四皇子二皇女を出産する。
sen.e: She gave birth to four princes and two princesses.
She gave birth to four princes and two princesses.
She gave birth to four princes and two princesses.

sen.j: うち末子の皇子が霊元天皇となる。
sen.e: The youngest prince became Emperor Reigen.
The youngest prince became the Emperor Reigen.
The youngest prince became the Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の中宮は徳川和子であったため、息子の霊元天皇の即位後にも皇太后位が授与されることはなかった。
sen.e: Because Kazuko TOGUGAWA was the Empress of Emperor Gomizunoo, Kuniko was not given the title of Emperor Dowager even after the enthronement of her son.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because Kazuko TOGUGAWA was the empress of the Emperor Gomizunoo, Kuniko was not given the title of emperor dowager even after the enthronement of her son, the Emperor Reigen.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Empress→empress,Emperor Dowager→emperor dowager と修正しました。「霊元天皇」を補いました。
sen.e: Because Kazuko TOGUGAWA was the empress of the Emperor Gomizunoo, Kuniko was not given the title of emperor dowager even after the enthronement of her son, the Emperor Reigen.

sen.j: しかし、延宝5年（1677年）7月5日、国子が危篤状態になるに及んで霊元天皇は急遽准三宮に叙し、また院号を与えて新広義門院とした。
sen.e: However, when Kuniko's condition became critical on July 5, 1677, Emperor Reigen gave her the rank of Jusangu (an honarary rank next to the Empresses) and the Ingo of Shinkogimonin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when Kuniko's condition became critical on August 3 1677, the Emperor Reigen conferred her the rank of Jusangu (an honarary rank next to the empresses) and the Ingo of Shinkogimonin.
sen.cmt: 延宝5年（1677年）7月5日→August 3, 1677 （グレゴリオ暦に変換）,gave→conferred,Empress→empress と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: However, when Kuniko's condition became critical on August 3 1677, the Emperor Reigen conferred her the rank of Jusangu (an honarary rank next to the empresses) and the Ingo of Shinkogimonin.

sen.j: しかし同日中に薨去している。
sen.e: She passed away on the same day.
But, she passed away on the same day.
But, she passed away on the same day.

sen.j: 彼女の存在は出身家である園家に大きな栄華をもたらし、彼女の父である園基音には左大臣が追贈され、兄の園基福には異例の准大臣の位が与えられた。
sen.e: She brought great prosperity to the SONO family, which is where she came from, and her father, Motonari SONO, was given the title of Sadaijin and her brother, Motoyoshi SONO, was given the exceptional title of Jun-daijin.

She brought a great prosperity to her home, the SONO family, and her father, Motonari SONO was posthumously conferred the court rank of Sadaijin, and her brother, Motoyoshi SONO, was given an exceptional title of Jun-daijin.
sen.cmt: 「追贈」を補い、全体をスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: She brought a great prosperity to her home, the SONO family, and her father, Motonari SONO was posthumously conferred the court rank of Sadaijin, and her brother, Motoyoshi SONO, was given an exceptional title of Jun-daijin.

sen.j: もともと園家は権中納言を極官とする下級公家だったが、これ以降の園家当主は早世した者をのぞき全員が権大納言となっており、羽林家一の名門家となった。
sen.e: Although the Sono family was originally a lower court noble with the highest rank of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor), all the heads of the SONO family that followed, with the exception of those who died young, became Gon Dainagon and the SONO family became the most noble of the Urin family.

After that, all the heads of the SONO family became Gon Dainagon except those who died young, and the SONO family became the most noble of the Urin family, although the Sono family was originally a lower court noble with the highest rank of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor).
sen.cmt: After that を補いました。オーダーを修正しスムースにしました。with the exception→except と修正しました。
sen.e: After that, all the heads of the SONO family became Gon Dainagon except those who died young, and the SONO family became the most noble of the Urin family, although the Sono family was originally a lower court noble with the highest rank of Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Councilor).

sen.j: 明治維新後にも子爵ではなく伯爵となった羽林家のひとつである。
sen.e: The SONO family is one of the families which became a count and not a viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
The SONO family is the one of the Urin families which became a count and not a viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: the, Urin を補いました。
sen.e: The SONO family is the one of the Urin families which became a count and not a viscount after the Meiji Restoration.
